Description: Glazed white steatite scarab: engraved in the edge with a hieroglyphic arrangement: 'wn', a female figure holding a flower on a long stalk 'nb' sign on edge behind her. This may refer to the goddess 'wnw.t' of Hermopolis.
Curator's comments: See Bonnet, 'Reallexikon der Ägyptischen Religionsgeschichte' pp. 841-842.
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.144, no.20)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
